page.title: 15Organisations in Codsall
page.content: The Codsall and District Civic Society was formed in December 1966. Its main aim was to stimulate the interest of people in Codsall,Bilbrook,Codsall Wood and Oaken in their living environment. Amongst its efforts to date has been the setting up of what is believed to be the first Nature Trail confined to Public Footpaths;the giving of evidence to Motorway and Structure Plan Public Enquiries;a major role in securing for the villages the sculpture "The Lone Singer" by the late Sir Charles Wheeler who was the Society's first President. It also presents its own annual award,a wood Sculpture by a former Codsall High School Student, for Services to the Community. The Society holds monthly meetings throughout Autumn and Winter with occasional Spring/Summer outings. Subjects for the former range from Wildlife to History. All ages may join.
